unnormalised: The Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) has announced a change of address for its passport seva kendras in Delhi-NCR, effective 10/11/2024. Citizens are advised to note the new locations for all passport-related services. The move aims to streamline operations and improve accessibility for applicants.
normalised: The Ministry of External Affairs (M-E-A) has announced a change of address for its passport seva kendras in Delhi-N-C-R, effective tenth november two thousand and twenty four. Citizens are advised to note the new locations for all passport related services. The move aims to streamline operations and improve accessibility for applicants.

unnormalised: The primary passport office is now located at Plot No. 21, Institutional Area, Sector 44, Gurugram, Haryana, 122003. This change affects all appointments scheduled on or after the aforementioned date. Existing appointments will be automatically re-routed to the new location. Applicants are requested to confirm their updated appointment details online before proceeding.
normalised: The primary passport office is now located at Plot Number twenty one, Institutional Area, Sector forty four, Gurugram, Haryana, one two two zero zero three. This change affects all appointments scheduled on or after the aforementioned date. Existing appointments will be automatically re-routed to the new location. Applicants are requested to confirm their updated appointment details online before proceeding.

unnormalised: Additionally, the regional office, formerly at Bhikaji Cama Place, New Delhi, has been relocated to Jeevan Bharati Building, Tower 2, Level 6, Connaught Circus, New Delhi, 110001. This move is intended to enhance the office's operational efficiency and provide a more convenient location for citizens residing in central Delhi. Contact number remains +91-11-26182345.
normalised: Additionally, the regional office, formerly at Bhikaji Cama Place, New Delhi, has been relocated to Jeevan Bharati Building, Tower two, Level six, Connaught Circus, New Delhi, one one zero zero zero one. This move is intended to enhance the office's operational efficiency and provide a more convenient location for citizens residing in central Delhi. Contact number remains plus ninety one hyphen eleven hyphen two six one eight two three four five.

unnormalised: The MEA advises the public to verify address information on the official passport portal before visiting any passport office. For further clarifications, citizens may contact the helpline at 1800-258-0077 or email their queries to passport.query@mea.gov.in. These changes are part of the government's ongoing efforts to modernise and improve public services.
normalised: The M-E-A advises the public to verify address information on the official passport portal before visiting any passport office. For further clarifications, citizens may contact the helpline at one eight zero zero hyphen two five eight hyphen zero zero seven seven or email their queries to passport dot query at m-e-a dot gov dot in. These changes are part of the government's ongoing efforts to modernise and improve public services.
